We consider three degrees of freedom in the clustering approach and how they influence our results. In the first case, we consider how modifying the desired number of clusters changes the distribution of regions. Supporting information Figure S1 illustrates that varying n
c produces the desired effect of splitting the domain into broadly equally sized regions, with borders separating different climatological regimes. This analysis, as for the main analysis in the paper, uses distance weights which combine mean precipitation, fraction of dry days and the 95th percentile of precipitation.
